nodes.bodyText: Normally I refrain from changing the standard test data, but this seemed safe.

nodes.bodyText:
Two questions:

Is this second constructor even needed, if it isn't even the recommended way to use this?
If it is, it should not be copying all of this setting logic, but instead first calling the other constructor, and then setting the additional properties.

I debated just removing it.  Seemed like it would be safe to remove since people shouldn't be using it directly, but since I'm planning on backporting I figured I'd keep it around to be safe.
But, agreed, I'll change it not to be repetitive... I was thinking that one constructor couldn't call another, but maybe I'm wrong about that...
Would be useful to an add an @SInCE annotation to any new public methods that your are introducing (here and elsewhere in this PR).
